meanings.definition: The quality or state of being quizzical.
meanings.sent1: Her quizzicality was evident as she raised an eyebrow in confusion.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't help but smile at the quizzicality on his face when he saw the magic trick.
meanings.sent3: The cat's quizzicality at the sight of a cucumber behind it was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His quizzicality towards the concept of time being a river flowing endlessly intrigued me.
meanings.sent5: The quizzicality of the child's gaze as he tried to understand the riddle was endearing.

meanings.sent1: She gave him a look of quizzicality, unsure of what he meant.
meanings.sent2: The puppy tilted its head in adorable quizzicality at the strange sound.
meanings.sent3: The quizzicality on his face when he tasted the spicy food was priceless.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a quizzicality that seemed to question the very fabric of reality.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's quizzicality as she tried to solve the math problem was contagious.
